intro: Meliosma dentata, commonly known as the toothed meliosma, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated margins, giving it its common name. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-yellow and appear in clusters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
